name: way
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: Do you know the way to the restaurant?
example.egtrans: 你知道去餐馆怎么走吗？

example.eg: I've only been living in Madrid for a couple of weeks so I don't really know my way around it yet.
example.egtrans: 我只在马德里住了几个星期，所以还不太认识周围的路。

example.eg: We'll have to stop for petrol on the way to the airport.
example.egtrans: 我们得在去机场的路上停下来加油。

example.eg: Can you find your own way out of the building?
example.egtrans: 你自己能找对路走出这栋楼吗？

example.eg: He elbowed/pushed his way (= hit/pushed people so that he could go past them) to the front of the crowd.
example.egtrans: 他用胳膊肘／手推搡出一条路，挤到了人群前面。

example.eg: The bus stopped for us to eat lunch but within half an hour we were on our way/under way (= travelling) again.
example.egtrans: 长途汽车停下来让我们吃午饭，不过不到半小时，我们又上路了。

example.eg: There's no way through here - you'll have to go round.
example.egtrans: 这里没有路通过去——你们得绕行。

example.eg: They flew from Los Angeles to Toronto by way of Chicago.
example.egtrans: 他们途径芝加哥从拉斯维加斯飞到多伦多。

example.eg: Many people have lost their way (= become lost) in the forest.
example.egtrans: 很多人在森林里迷了路。

example.eg: Only local people could find their way through the maze of narrow streets.
example.egtrans: 只有本地人才能在迷宫般的狭窄街道中找到路。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to talk about the direction in which something is facing

example.eg: "Which way does the room face?" "North."
example.egtrans: “这个房间朝哪个方向？”“朝北。”

example.eg: Which way up should this box be? (= Which side should be on top?)
example.egtrans: 这个箱子应该哪一面朝上？

example.eg: The numbers are the wrong way round - it should be 71, not 17.
example.egtrans: 那个数字颠倒了——应该是71，不是17。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to travel or move to a place

example.eg: We slowly made our way down the river.
example.egtrans: 我们慢慢地沿河而下。

example.eg: It's getting late - we should make our way home soon.
example.egtrans: 天晚了——我们应该动身回家了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式

example.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way round.
example.egtrans: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式

example.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way around.
example.egtrans: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used in the names of some roads

example.eg: Our offices are at 17 King's Way.
example.egtrans: 我们的办事处在国王路17号。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a distance or a period of time

example.eg: We walked a long way yesterday.
example.egtrans: 昨天我们走了很长的一段路。

example.eg: The holiday seems like it's a long way off.
example.egtrans: 假期似乎还很遥远。

example.eg: We managed to pull ourselves all the way from 12th place to first place.
example.egtrans: 我们设法从第12名一直上升到第一名。

example.eg: They still have a ways to go.
example.egtrans: 他们还要走一段路。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular choice, opinion, belief, or action, especially from among several possibilities

example.eg: I like the way you've done your hair.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢你的发型。

example.eg: In some/many ways it would be better if we met on Monday rather than Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 从某些／好多方面来说，我们周一见面要比周三见面好一些。

example.eg: In a way (= partly), I would rather they didn't come because it will mean extra work.
example.egtrans: 从某一方面来说，我不太愿意他们来，因为那将意味着要额外操劳。

example.eg: He might have to resign or he might be demoted, but either way, his career is effectively over.
example.egtrans: 他可能要被迫辞职或被降职，但不管怎么说，他的事业实际上已经结束了。

example.eg: They don't write songs the way (= as) they used to.
example.egtrans: 他们不像以前那样写歌了。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the manner in which someone behaves or thinks, or in which something happens
trans_examp.trans_cn: （思维）风格；（行事）作风；（某事发生的）方式

example.eg: Don't worry - it's just his way.
example.egtrans: 别害怕——他就那样。

example.eg: He looked at me in a sinister way.
example.egtrans: 他恶狠狠地看着我。

example.eg: It's amazing the way she manages to stay so calm.
example.egtrans: 她能保持如此镇定真让人惊讶。

example.eg: The way he was shouting, you'd have thought he was badly hurt.
example.egtrans: 看他大喊大叫的样子，还以为他受了重伤。

example.eg: To my way of thinking, they shouldn't be building so many roads.
example.egtrans: 依我看，他们不该修这么多路。

example.eg: It's always the way at work - either I have nothing to do or I'm rushed off my feet!
example.egtrans: 我工作时总是这样——要么无事可做，要么忙得停不住脚！

example.eg: Over the years we've got used to his funny little ways.
example.egtrans: 多年来，我们已经习惯了他那些滑稽的举动了。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an action that can produce the result you want; a method

example.eg: There are many ways of solving the problem.
example.egtrans: 解决这个问题有多种方法。

example.eg: That's not the way to do it - let me show you.
example.egtrans: 这样做不对——让我给你示范一下。

example.eg: That method hasn't worked, so let's try your way.
example.egtrans: 那个方法没用，所以让我们试试您的方法。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the space needed for a particular movement or action

example.eg: "Sorry, am I in your way? I'll move."
example.egtrans: 对不起，我挡了您的路吗？我马上让开。

example.eg: I couldn't see the stage because there was a pillar in the way (= between me and the stage).
example.egtrans: 我看不到舞台，因为有一根柱子挡在我和舞台之间。

example.eg: Make way for some new clothes by clearing out ones you never wear.
example.egtrans: 通过清除那些不穿的为新衣服清理出一些空间来。

example.eg: You need to get out of the way of that car.
example.egtrans: 你需要给那辆车让开道。

example.eg: She's determined to succeed and she won't let anything get/stand in her way (= prevent her).
example.egtrans: 她下决心要取得成功，她不会让任何事情妨碍她。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone gets or has their way, what they want happens.

example.eg: If she doesn't get/have her (own) way, she sulks like a four-year-old.
example.egtrans: 如果一切不是都按她的意愿来，她就会像个四岁小孩一样生气。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the bad condition or state of someone or something, especially the state of a person's health

example.eg: He's been in a bad way (= very ill) ever since the operation.
example.egtrans: 自从那次手术以来，他一直病得很重。

name: way
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize degree or separation, especially in space or time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 过度，大幅（尤其用于强调时间或空间中的程度或距离）

example.eg: After the third lap, she was way behind the other runners.
example.egtrans: 跑过第三圈后，她已远远落后其他运动员。

example.eg: She spends way too much money on clothes.
example.egtrans: 她花太多的钱买衣服。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

example.eg: I think they live Birmingham way.
example.egtrans: 我认为他们住在伯明翰那一带。
